title: Make your own cartoon!

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Homophone song: There, Their, They're

multiple-choice.question: What are homophones?

options.label: A
options.text: Words that sound the same but have different meanings

options.label: B
options.text: Words that sound the same but have different spellings and meanings

options.label: C
options.text: Words that have the same meaning but different pronunciations

options.label: D
options.text: Words that have different meanings but the same pronunciation

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between "there," "their," and "they're"?

options.label: A
options.text: They all refer to different places

options.label: C
options.text: "There" is a place, "their" shows possession, and "they're" is a contraction of "they are"

options.label: D
options.text: They all refer to different people

multiple-choice.question: What is an apostrophe used for in the context of homophones?
What is a contraction, and how is it used in the context of homophones?

options.label: A
options.text: A contraction is a word that has been shortened to make it easier to say

options.label: B
options.text: A contraction is a word that has been combined with another word to make a new word

options.label: C
options.text: A contraction is a word that has been used to indicate possession

options.label: D
options.text: A contraction is a word that has been used to indicate a place

multiple-choice.question: What is the mnemonic device used in the transcript to help remember the correct usage of homophones?

options.label: A
options.text: "There, there, there is the place I want to be"

multiple-choice.question: What is the main point of the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: To explain the difference between "there," "their," and "they're"

options.label: B
options.text: To provide a mnemonic device for remembering homophones

options.label: C
options.text: To explain the importance of using an apostrophe in homophones

options.label: D
options.text: To explain the concept of homophones

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's tone in the transcript?
What is the purpose of the music in the transcript?

options.label: B
options.text: To illustrate the concept of homophones

options.label: C
options.text: To make the transcript more enjoyable

options.label: D
options.text: To distract from the main point

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge faced by people when it comes to homophones?

options.label: B
options.text: Difficulty in remembering the correct spelling

options.label: C
options.text: Difficulty in understanding the correct meaning

options.label: D
options.text: Difficulty in using the correct apostrophe

multiple-choice.question: What is the key takeaway from the transcript?

options.label: D
options.text: Homophones are not relevant in everyday life
